https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Studies related to and associated with the technological advancement of drilling operations, aimed at mitigating the drilling operational deficiencies and instabilities that could hinder operational performance activities and the economic part of drilling development with great effort to minimize their environmental footprint. It includes geoscience-related results obtained during the testing of improved or emerging technologies.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value:
Definition adapted from: 
Teodoriu, C and Opeyemi, B 2021, An outlook of drilling technologies and innovations: present status and future trends: Energies, 14, 4499, doi.10.3390/en14154499.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: Studies related to and associated with the technological advancement of drilling operations, aimed at mitigating the drilling operational deficiencies and instabilities that could hinder operational performance activities and the economic part of drilling development with great effort to minimize their environmental footprint.
